title: Camila Cabello leaves a silly comment after her boyfriend Shawn Mendes takes a photo with a quokka
text:
Australia has its fair share of unique animals.

And on Saturday a smiling Shawn Mendes shared a trio of selfies of himself with a cute little member of the marsupial family.

He captioned it, simply, 'I met a Quokka !!!'

Scroll down for video

So cute: Shawn Mendes is on the Australian leg of his world tour and on Saturday he shared a trio of selfie of himself with a little member of the marsupial family

The 21-year-old singer is in Australia for his world tour and spent some time on Rottnest Island where they breed.

The snaps show him smiling broadly as he lay on his tummy next to a quokka who seemed completely unphased and carried on nibbling a leaf.

Shawn's girlfriend Camila Cabello obviously has a sense of humor as she was quick to comment, 'I love this picture of us!'

Gotta love it: The 21-year-old singer captioned it simply, saying, 'Today I met a Quokka'

Fur friend: GF Camila Cabello was quick to add a jokey comment on her beau's quokka snaps saying, 'I love this picture of us!'

She was probably happier with the very loved up snap of them together that he posted the day before.

It showed Camilla snuggling up to his neck and he added a heart emoji.

Camila and Shawn met at Austin Mahone's 2014 Live On Tour concerts where the pair were both support acts for the American singer.

Loved up: Shawn also posted this snap of Camila snggling up to his new with a heart emoji

No hiding it now: There was no denying their love during the pair's steamy performance of Senorita at the MTV Video Music Awards in August

She was performing with Fifth Harmony while Shawn was solo.

They became good friends and collaborators but it took a few years for that to develop into something more serious.

There was no denying their love during the pair's steamy performance of Senorita at the MTV Video Music Awards in August.
description: The 21-year-old If I Can't Have You singer is in Australia for his world tour and spent some time at the weekend  hanging out on Rottnest Island where the cute cat-sized marsupials breed.
